thread.title: Video: Rex Ryan basically rules out LeSean McCoy, Sammy Watkins for Bills game against Giants
thread.title_full: Video: Rex Ryan basically rules out LeSean McCoy, Sammy Watkins for Bills game against Giants | syracuse.com

author: Matthew Fairburn | mfairburn@syracuse.com
title: Video: Rex Ryan basically rules out LeSean McCoy, Sammy Watkins for Bills game against Giants
text:
Orchard Park, N.Y. — The Buffalo Bills were again without wide receiver Sammy Watkins (calf) and running back LeSean McCoy (hamstring) Thursday, and it seems less and less likely the two will play against the Giants in Week 4.
When asked whether the two would play, Ryan said he didn't want to rule them out but basically did with his facial expression at the end of his answer.
If anyone had lingering hope that Watkins or McCoy would play Sunday, watch this video all the way through #Bills pic.twitter.com/coQG7mX3Ky
— Joe Buscaglia (@JoeBuscaglia) October 1, 2015 "We don't want to say out, but yeah, you guys can figure it out," Ryan said. "They didn't practice the whole week and all that stuff, but there is that chance," he added before shaking his head.
Buffalo was also without guard John Miller on Thursday as he works his way back from a groin injury he suffered against the Dolphins. Kicker Dan Carpenter left practice early Thursday, but Ryan expects him to play against the Giants.
Wide receiver Marquise Goodwin (ribs) and safety Aaron Williams (neck) were also limited. Meanwhile, quarterback Tyrod Taylor (ankle), linebacker Preston Brown (hamstring) and wide receiver Percy Harvin (hip) were full participants in practice.
